content.title: Intro
content.content:
-il is a little-attested ending in the Sindarin language,[note 1] used sometimes to denote feminine gender. Its masculine counterpart is -on.

Its presence causes i-affection to the vowels of the stem (cf. brannon and brennil).

content.title: Etymology
content.content: Possibly it derives from a Common Eldarin ending *-illê. This is supported by several Quenya words which end in -illë with Sindarin cognates in -il; most notably compare the Quenya amille "mother" and the Sindarin emil.

content.title: Examples
content.content:
emil "mother"[1]
odhril "parent (referring to mother)"
melethril "lover"[2]
brennil "lady"[2]
hiril "lady"[2]
Thuringwethil "secret-shadow woman"[3]

In at least one case, -il is said to be a diminutive ending; compare how the masculine ending -on can sometimes refer to "great" things.

niphredil "little pallor" (niphred)[2]
ernil "prince" (perhaps understood as *"little noble"; arn)

content.title: Notes
content.content: ↑ Some of the examples refer to Noldorin as well
